definition: peaceful coexistence of nations, societies etc
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
Zhou Enlai's Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence/1954 Panchsheel series of agreements between PRC and India
pinyin: he2 ping2 gong4 chu3 wu3 xiang4 yuan2 ze2

sentences.english: The Boskops coexisted with our Homo sapiens forebears.
sentences.chinese: 博斯科普人曾与我们的智人祖先和平共处。

sentences.english: There is no excuse to live in anything but a peaceful co-existence.
sentences.chinese: 世界上只应该有和平共处，而非其他方式。

sentences.english: And the people of Dor lived side by side with their rats.
sentences.chinese: 多尔国的人们和耗子们和平共处。

sentences.english: Synergy can be equated to being at peace within oneself.
sentences.chinese: 协同可以等同于跟自己和平共处。

sentences.english: There is a multilateral agreement to keep the peace between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 两国达成了一项和平共处的多边协议。

sentences.english: They stress harmony in handling human relations and stand for peaceful co-exitence in international relations.
sentences.chinese: 对待国际关系主张和平共处。

sentences.english: Why can’t people with opposing opinions peacefully coexist in the same environment?
sentences.chinese: 为什么意见相左的人就不能在同一屋檐下和平共处呢？

sentences.english: I had long ago made my peace with the tax man.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的税务官和平共处很久了。

sentences.english: Moreover, the five principles of peaceful co-existence were initially put forward by China and India.
sentences.chinese: 和平共处五项原则也是中国和印度最早提出的。

sentences.english: The five principles of peaceful coexistence are the external conditions of national right.
sentences.chinese: 和平共处五项基本原则是国权得以实现的外部条件。

sentences.english: National leaders spend much of their efforts trying to get warring factions to commit to peace again.
sentences.chinese: 国家领袖千辛万苦地使敌对的各方能重新和平共处。

sentences.english: It is believed that the islands can de a paradise when people live in peace.
sentences.chinese: 人们相信人们和平共处时，岛会成为天堂。

sentences.english: Pan has discovered; a mutual accommodation between farmers and pandas.
sentences.chinese: 潘文石还发现大熊猫和农民之间能够和平共处。

definition: to live in harmony/to get along with each other
to coexist/to get along (with others)
non-aggression
to live together in harmony
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
lit. to exchange weapons of war for gifts of jade and silk (idiom)/fig. to turn hostility into friendship
pinyin: hua4 gan1 ge1 wei2 yu4 bo2

definition: to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
everyone minds their own business

definition: to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to forget former enmity (idiom)
Heping district of Shenyang city 瀋陽市|沈阳市, Liaoning/Hoping township in Taichung county 臺中縣|台中县[Tai2 zhong1 xian4], Taiwan
